TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1635-1636
TEI.2.document_title: Antony R. Clarke to Stephen F. Austin, 05-04-1827

barker_notes.barker_summary: A. R. Clarke to Austin, May 4, 1827. Land and trade.
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1635-1636

text.body:
*div1 type="summary"* *p*A. R. Clarke to Austin, May 4, 1827. Land and trade.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p*Dear sir*/p*
*p*agreable to my promis I now address you by *person_mentioned*Mr Milbourn*/person_mentioned* I have to inform you that*person_mentioned* Mrs Page*/person_mentioned* coincides with me in wishing to receive the *location_mentioned*two Labours No 1 and No 2*/location_mentioned* If they can both be conveyed in one deed it will be best if not let there be two if in one they can be conveyed in the name of *person_mentioned*Eliza Page widow*/person_mentioned* of the late *person_mentioned*William A Page*/person_mentioned* her maiden name was *person_mentioned*Eliza Clarke*/person_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*I have paid *person_mentioned*Capt Chase*/person_mentioned* $10 for a bbl of flour on your account, and hope to be able to bring with me when I come to *location_mentioned*Town */location_mentioned*money to pay you if not the whole at least for the deeds and stamped paper but the prospect is not very bright, owing to *person_mentioned*Varner*/person_mentioned*s not being able to procure any money, we have had to advance every dollar we could scrape to make up the payment of the Hope, I[f] you should want Flour for your own use send an Order to me as I have some bbls to sell likewise hatts and salt—*/p*
*p*yours affectionately *person_mentioned*A. E. Clarke*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*Friday morning *date_mentioned n="05-04-1827">4th May 1827—*/date_mentioned**/p*
*p*[Addressed:] *person_mentioned*Col, S, F, Austin*/person_mentioned* *location_mentioned*San Phillip */location_mentioned* pr *person_mentioned*Mr Milbourn*/person_mentioned* */p* */div1*
